usecase_1: 在“智慧医疗数据空间”中，省级卫生信息中心作为数据提供者，发布了一个包含临床试验结果和患者统计（匿名汇总）的数据集（ClinicalTrialStats）。该数据集默认遵循联盟的基础数据共享政策，允许联盟内的医疗研究机构成员仅用于非商业性医学研究，且研究成果中必须注明数据来源。同时，卫生信息中心为特定的医疗器械企业合作伙伴制定了附加政策，允许其在医疗设备性能分析平台上商业性使用ClinicalTrialStats，前提是每半年向卫生信息中心提交使用报告并支付数据许可费用。此外，联盟政策严禁任何成员或第三方尝试还原匿名患者身份信息。
usecase_2: 在“能源物联网数据空间”中，国家电网公司作为数据提供者，发布了一个包含实时用电负荷和设备运行状态（匿名聚合）的数据集（GridUsageData）。该数据集根据联盟基础政策，允许联盟内的高校能源研究团队仅用于学术研究目的，且发表成果时需注明数据来源。同时，国家电网公司为特定的智能电网解决方案供应商设立了补充政策，允许其在能源调度优化平台上商业使用GridUsageData，条件是每季度向国家电网公司提交详细使用报告并支付许可费用。联盟政策明确禁止任何成员或第三方试图识别单一用户的用电信息。
usecase_3: 在“农业数据协作空间”中，省农业科技中心作为数据提供者，发布了包含农作物生长监测和产量统计（匿名化）的数据集（AgriGrowthData）。该数据集依据联盟基础政策，允许联盟内的农业科研机构成员仅限非营利性科研使用，且成果中需注明数据来源。同时，农业科技中心为特定的农业科技企业合作伙伴制定了额外政策，允许其在智能农场管理系统中商业性利用AgriGrowthData，前提是每季度向农业科技中心提交使用报告并缴纳数据许可费用。联盟政策严格禁止任何成员或第三方尝试还原农户身份信息。
usecase_4: 在“智慧物流数据空间”中，区域物流协会作为数据提供者，发布了包含货运车辆轨迹和装载量（匿名汇总）的数据集（LogiFleetData）。该数据集遵循联盟基础数据共享政策，允许联盟内的高校物流研究团队仅限于非商业性学术研究，且研究成果需注明数据来源。同时，物流协会为特定的物流平台企业合作伙伴设定了附加政策，允许其在运输调度优化平台上商业性使用LogiFleetData，条件是每季度向物流协会提交使用报告并支付许可费用。联盟政策严禁任何成员或第三方试图还原单一货运车辆或司机身份。
usecase_5: 在“绿色建筑数据空间”中，市建筑节能中心作为数据提供者，发布了包含建筑能耗和设备运行（匿名化）的数据集（GreenBuildingData）。该数据集依据联盟基础政策，允许联盟内的建筑设计院成员仅限于非商业性节能研究，且成果中需注明数据来源。同时，建筑节能中心为特定的节能技术企业合作伙伴制定了补充政策，允许其在建筑能效评估平台上商业性使用GreenBuildingData，前提是每季度向建筑节能中心提交使用报告并支付数据许可费用。联盟政策严格禁止任何成员或第三方尝试还原单一建筑或住户的身份信息。
usecase_6: 智慧医疗数据空间管理方须制定统一的机构准入审核机制，涵盖申请受理、技术能力验证及合规信用评估。申请机构需通过官方门户提交资质材料及医疗数据应用场景说明，管理方应在3个工作日内完成材料完整性初审。技术验证阶段需利用自动化工具对机构的系统安全性、数据处理能力及接口标准进行合规检测，重点检查是否符合《电子健康档案安全规范》二级认证及数据加密、访问权限等关键要求。信用评估环节应对接国家医疗信用信息平台，核查机构历史违规记录、法律诉讼及行业信用等级，涉外机构需额外核验其数据跨境合规备案。审核通过名单需公示2个工作日无异议后方可正式接入，整个流程各环节应通过区块链技术留存不可篡改的审查凭证，确保全程可追溯。
usecase_7: 绿色能源数据联盟运营方应建立标准化成员资质审核流程，包括申请受理、技术合规性验证和信用评估。申请成员需通过联盟统一平台提交资质证明及绿色能源应用场景说明，运营方应在7个工作日内完成材料初步审核。技术合规性验证需借助自动化检测系统，对成员的能源数据采集方案、信息安全措施及接口协议进行评估，重点核查是否满足ISO 27001安全标准及数据加密、访问控制等核心要求。信用评估环节需接入国家企业信用信息公示系统，核查成员历史经营异常、法律诉讼及行业信用等级，跨境成员需额外提交数据出境合规证明。通过名单需公示5个工作日无异议后方可正式加入，审核各环节应利用区块链存证，确保流程透明且不可篡改。
usecase_8: 智慧物流数据空间管理机构应设立统一的企业资质审核流程，涵盖申请受理、技术能力验证和信用评估。申请企业需通过数据空间门户提交资质文件及物流数据应用场景说明，管理机构应在4个工作日内完成材料完整性初审。技术能力验证阶段需依托自动化检测工具，对企业的物流数据处理系统、安全防护能力及接口标准进行合规性评估，重点核查是否符合《物流信息安全规范》二级认证及数据加密、访问控制等要求。信用评估环节应接入全国企业信用信息平台，核查企业历史经营异常、司法诉讼及行业信用评级，跨境企业需额外核验其数据跨境合规备案。审核通过名单需公示3个工作日无异议后正式准入，审核流程各环节应通过区块链技术留存不可篡改的记录，保障全程可追溯。
usecase_9: 工业互联网数据空间运营方需建立标准化的供应商资质审核机制，流程包括申请受理、技术方案验证及信用评估。供应商需通过统一入口提交资质证明和工业数据应用场景说明，运营方应在5个工作日内完成材料初审。技术方案验证阶段需借助自动化检测平台，对供应商的系统架构、安全能力及接口合规性进行评估，重点核查是否符合《工业信息安全标准》三级认证及数据加密、访问控制等核心指标。信用评估环节应对接国家企业信用信息系统，核查供应商历史经营异常、司法涉诉及行业信用等级，涉外供应商需额外提交数据出境合规备案。通过名单需公示3个工作日无异议后正式接入，审核流程各环节应利用区块链存证，确保过程可追溯且不可篡改。
usecase_10: 智慧农业数据空间管理方应制定统一的合作方资质审核流程，包含申请受理、技术能力验证及信用评估。合作方需通过官方平台提交资质证明及农业数据应用场景说明，管理方应在2个工作日内完成材料完整性初审。技术能力验证阶段需依托自动化检测工具，对合作方的数据采集系统、安全防护能力及接口标准进行合规性评估，重点核查是否符合《农业数据安全规范》二级认证及数据加密、访问控制等要求。信用评估环节应接入全国企业信用信息平台，核查合作方历史经营异常、司法诉讼及行业信用评级，跨境合作方需额外核验其数据跨境合规备案。通过名单需公示1个工作日无异议后正式准入，审核流程各环节应通过区块链技术留存不可篡改的记录，确保全流程可追溯。
usecase_11: 在“智慧医疗数据空间”中，要求“医院数据提供方”在接入“临床试验结果”时，必须建立基于《GB/T 43697-2024数据安全技术 数据分类分级规则》的分级分类、质量评估与合规筛查三重审核体系。数据需按一般、重要、核心类别，并结合敏感性（如患者隐私、公共健康、科研数据）、应用场景（医学研究、政策制定、医疗服务）、风险等级（1-4级）进行标注。对于3级及以上数据，需额外进行数据溯源和用途范围条款审查。质量标准包括数据完整性≥98%、字段填充率≥95%、实时性≤1秒，接入时需提交由质量检测工具生成的评估报告。同时，必须对数据采集合法性和授权完整性进行合规性核查。
usecase_12: 在“能源数据互联平台”中，规定“电力公司”在接入“分布式能源消耗数据”时，必须遵循《GB/T 43697-2024数据安全技术 数据分类分级规则》进行数据分类分级，并建立质量评估和合规筛查机制。数据需按一般、重要、核心类别，结合数据敏感性（如用户用电信息、企业能耗、行业统计）、应用场景（能效分析、市场预测、政策监管）、风险等级（1-4级）进行标注。3级及以上数据需进行血缘追溯和用途限制条款审核。质量要求为完整性≥98%、字段填充率≥95%、数据延迟≤1秒，接入时需提交质量检测工具生成的报告。还需重点审查数据采集的合法性及授权文件的完整性。
usecase_13: 在“智慧农业数据联盟”中，要求“农企数据提供者”在接入“作物生长监测数据”时，必须建立分类分级、质量评估和合规筛查三位一体的审核体系，依据《GB/T 43697-2024数据安全技术 数据分类分级规则》进行分类，涵盖一般、重要、核心数据。需从数据敏感性（如农户隐私、气象数据、行业数据）、应用场景（精准农业、科研、政策制定）、风险等级（1-4级）三方面进行标注。3级及以上数据需进行数据血缘追溯和用途范围条款审查。质量标准包括数据完整性≥98%、字段填充率≥95%、实时性≤1秒，接入时须提交由检测工具生成的质量评估报告，并对数据采集合法性和授权完整性进行合规性审查。
usecase_14: 在“智慧城市数据空间”内，规定“城市基础设施运营商”在接入“实时交通流量数据”时，必须建立基于《GB/T 43697-2024数据安全技术 数据分类分级规则》的分类分级、质量评估和合规筛查体系。数据需按一般、重要、核心类别，结合敏感性（如个人出行、公共交通、行业数据）、应用场景（交通管理、城市规划、商业分析）、风险等级（1-4级）进行标注。3级及以上数据需进行数据血缘追溯和用途限定条款审查。质量要求为数据完整性≥98%、字段填充率≥95%、实时性≤1秒，接入时需由质量检测工具生成评估报告，并对数据采集的合法性及授权完整性进行重点合规性审核。
usecase_15: 在“工业互联网数据空间”中，要求“智能制造企业”在接入“设备运行日志数据”时，必须建立分类分级、质量评估和合规筛查三重管控体系，依据《GB/T 43697-2024数据安全技术 数据分类分级规则》进行分类，包括一般、重要、核心数据。需从数据敏感性（如企业机密、生产参数、行业数据）、应用场景（设备预测性维护、生产优化、合规审计）、风险等级（1-4级）三方面进行标注。3级及以上数据需进行数据血缘追溯和用途范围条款审查。质量标准为数据完整性≥98%、字段填充率≥95%、实时性≤1秒，接入时需提交质量检测工具生成的评估报告，并对数据采集的合法性和授权完整性进行合规性审查。
usecase_16: 在“医疗数据互联空间”中，若数据归属存在争议或合规性不明确，参与方可通过指定仲裁机构解决。运营协议须明确仲裁方，仲裁流程要求争议双方于2个工作日内提交所有相关证明材料（如数据采集同意书、处理日志等）；仲裁裁决将由区块链智能合约自动执行，若数据被判违规则立即触发链上数据销毁；如争议涉及公共卫生安全，须第一时间上报国家卫健委并冻结相关数据访问权限。
usecase_17: 在“能源数据共享联盟”内，针对权属或合规性有疑问的数据，允许通过第三方仲裁机构裁决。联盟协议需指明仲裁机构，仲裁流程要求各方在5个工作日内提交完整的授权与处理凭证；仲裁结果通过智能合约自动落实，若认定数据违规则自动执行数据删除；如争议数据涉及国家能源安全，须立即报告国家能源局并暂停相关数据账户。
usecase_18: 在“智慧城市数据空间”中，若数据归属或合规性存在异议，争议方可依照协议约定的仲裁机构进行仲裁。协议需明确仲裁流程，要求各方于3个工作日内提交数据授权证明、处理记录等证据；仲裁结果由智能合约自动执行，若数据被判违规则立即触发数据销毁流程；如涉及城市安全，需即时上报市级网信部门并冻结相关数据流转。
usecase_19: 在“工业互联网数据联盟”内，针对归属不明或合规性存疑的数据，允许通过联盟指定仲裁机构裁决。联盟协议须明确仲裁流程，争议方需在2个工作日内提交数据采集授权、处理记录等完整证据；仲裁结果通过链上智能合约自动执行，若数据被判违规则立即销毁；如争议涉及国家工业安全，须立即上报工信部并冻结相关账户。
usecase_20: 在“金融数据交换平台”中，若数据权属或合规性存在争议，参与机构可通过协议指定的仲裁机构进行裁决。协议应明确仲裁流程，要求争议方在4个工作日内提交全部授权及处理记录等证据链；仲裁结果由智能合约自动执行，若数据被判违规则自动触发数据销毁；如争议数据涉及金融安全，须立即上报央行并冻结相关账户。
usecase_21: 在“智慧医疗数据空间”中，要求所有成员机构通过统一API实现医疗数据的注册、检索与交付全流程互通。接口标准：数据目录检索接口需支持跨医院联合查询，并返回数据可用性状态（如“可直接访问”“需伦理审批”）；数据交付接口应兼容HL7 FHIR等主流协议，支持分段加密及动态寻址，确保高敏感健康数据采用“可用不可见”模式交付。数据交互流程包括：发布阶段，数据提供方需通过加密通道上传数据并生成带有哈希与数字签名的完整性凭证；检索阶段，用户可检索空间内资源，结果需返回可用性状态并自动屏蔽未授权内容；交付阶段，数据交付需采用加密传输，3级及以上敏感数据必须通过隐私计算平台或可信执行环境（TEE）实现价值释放，严禁明文传输。
usecase_22: 在“能源物联网数据空间”中，电力公司与设备制造商必须通过标准化接口完成能耗数据的发布、查询和交付。接口要求：目录查询接口需支持跨企业联合检索，返回数据可用性（如“可实时获取”“需审批”）；交付接口应兼容MQTT等主流协议，支持分片加密与动态路由，确保高敏感能耗数据以“可用不可见”方式交付。流程包括：发布时，数据方通过加密通道上传数据并生成哈希及数字签名凭证；查询时，用户可检索资源，结果需显示可用性并自动过滤未授权数据；交付时，数据需加密传输，3级及以上敏感数据必须通过TEE或隐私计算框架处理，禁止明文交付。
usecase_23: 在“智慧农业数据空间”中，农企与科研机构须通过统一接口实现作物生长数据的发布、检索与交付。接口规范：目录检索接口需支持跨区域联合查询，返回数据可用性（如“可直接下载”“需合作协议”）；交付接口应兼容RESTful等主流协议，支持分片加密和动态寻址，确保高敏感农情数据以“可用不可见”模式交付。流程包括：发布阶段，数据方通过加密通道上传数据并生成哈希与数字签名凭证；检索阶段，用户可检索资源，结果需返回可用性并自动屏蔽未授权内容；交付阶段，数据交付需加密传输，3级及以上敏感数据必须通过TEE或隐私计算框架实现价值释放，严禁明文传输。
usecase_24: 在“智慧城市交通数据空间”中，交通管理局与出行服务商需通过标准化接口贯通交通流量数据的发布、检索和交付。接口要求：目录查询接口需支持跨部门联合检索，返回数据可用性（如“可直接调用”“需审批”）；交付接口应兼容HTTPS等主流协议，支持分片加密与动态寻址，确保高敏感交通数据以“可用不可见”模式交付。流程包括：发布阶段，数据方通过加密通道上传数据并生成哈希及数字签名凭证；检索阶段，用户可检索资源，结果需返回可用性并自动过滤未授权内容；交付阶段，数据交付需加密传输，3级及以上敏感数据必须通过TEE或隐私计算框架实现价值释放，禁止明文传输。
usecase_25: 在“工业制造数据空间”中，设备供应商与工厂运营商须通过标准化接口实现设备运行数据的全流程发布、查询与交付。接口规范：目录检索接口需支持跨工厂联合检索，返回数据可用性（如“可直接集成”“需授权”）；交付接口应兼容OPC UA等主流协议，支持分片加密和动态寻址，确保高敏感设备数据以“可用不可见”模式交付。流程包括：发布阶段，数据方通过加密通道上传数据并生成哈希与数字签名凭证；检索阶段，用户可检索资源，结果需返回可用性并自动屏蔽未授权内容；交付阶段，数据交付需加密传输，3级及以上敏感数据必须通过TEE或隐私计算框架实现价值释放，严禁明文传输。
usecase_26: 在“智慧医疗数据空间”中，要求所有健康数据服务商每12个月接受一次数据隐私与安全能力复核，若复核未达标，给予90天整改期，逾期未合格者将被暂停数据访问权限，并对医疗数据产品供应商实施持续合规监控；所有已接入的临床试验结果数据每6个月进行质量抽检，若抽检不合格率高于5%，则需重新提交全部数据进行全面审核；当医疗数据相关法律法规或国家标准发生更新或出台新规时，须在30个工作日内修订审核流程并通知所有成员，确保其在整改期或新规生效前完成合规调整。
usecase_27: 在“能源物联网数据联盟”中，规定所有能源管理平台运营商每12个月必须接受一次信息安全能力复核，未通过者有90天整改期，整改后仍不合格将被移除联盟白名单，并对数据产品及服务提供商实施动态合规检查；所有已接入的电网运行数据每6个月进行一次质量抽查，若不合格率超过5%，则需重新提交全部数据进行全面复核；当能源数据相关法律或联盟标准修订或新增时，须在30个工作日内更新审核标准并通知所有成员，要求其在规定期限内完成合规整改。
usecase_28: 在“智慧农业数据空间”中，所有农业技术服务商需每12个月接受一次数据安全与合规能力复审，未达标者有90天整改期，逾期仍不合格将被移出服务商列表，并对农业数据产品和服务提供商实施动态合规监督；所有已接入的作物生长监测数据每6个月进行质量抽检，若抽检不合格率超过5%，则需重新提交全量数据进行审核；如遇农业数据相关法律法规或国家标准调整，须在30个工作日内修订审核规范并通知所有参与方，要求其在整改期或新规生效前完成合规调整。
usecase_29: 在“智慧城市数据空间”中，所有城市基础设施数据服务商需每12个月进行一次数据安全能力复评，未通过者给予90天整改期，整改后仍不合格将被移出服务商名录，并对数据产品及服务提供商实施动态合规检查；所有已接入的城市交通流量数据每6个月进行质量抽检，若抽检不合格率超过5%，则需重新提交全部数据进行全面审核；当城市数据相关法律法规或国家标准修订或新颁布时，须在30个工作日内更新审核规则并通知所有成员，要求其在整改期限内或新规生效前完成合规调整。
usecase_30: 在“工业互联网数据空间”中，所有设备制造商每12个月需接受一次数据安全与合规能力复核，未达标者有90天整改期，逾期未合格将被移除合作名单，并对数据产品和服务提供商实施动态合规审查；所有已接入的设备运行状态数据每6个月进行质量抽检，若抽检不合格率超过5%，则需重新提交全部数据进行全面审核；如遇工业数据相关法律法规或国家标准更新，应在30个工作日内修订审核流程并通知所有参与方，督促其在整改期限内或新规生效前完成合规整改。
usecase_31: 在“智慧医疗数据联盟”中，要求所有数据使用活动通过“日志存证-多方安全计算-异常熔断”机制实现全流程可追溯。日志管理需覆盖数据查询、分析、传输及销毁环节，涉及敏感诊疗数据访问或跨境共享时，必须附加多方安全计算（MPC）证明，相关证明经哈希后锚定至联盟区块链，原始日志保存时间不得少于6年。个人健康信息处理应采用同态加密与联邦学习等隐私增强技术，确保“数据可用不可见”；统计数据共享需满足差分隐私（ε≤1.0）标准。数据服务提供方需对技术方案合规性负责，并向联盟管理方提交第三方合规检测报告。异常熔断机制规定，若单日异常访问量超过日均120%，则自动分三级响应：一级暂停相关账户，二级隔离受影响数据，三级启动联盟全域安全巡检。解除熔断需同时满足管理方完成根因分析及服务方重新通过安全认证。
usecase_32: 在“能源物联网数据空间”内，所有数据操作需通过“日志存证-同态加密验证-异常熔断”保障全生命周期可追溯。日志必须涵盖数据采集、处理、传输与销毁全过程，关键操作如用户用能数据访问或数据出境时，需附加同态加密证明，证明内容哈希后锚定至能源联盟区块链，原始日志保存期限不少于4年。个人用能信息处理应采用联邦学习等隐私增强技术，统计数据共享需满足差分隐私（ε≤2.0）要求。数据服务商负责技术合规性验证，并向平台运营方提交第三方检测报告。若单日异常访问量超过日均130%，自动触发三级熔断：一级暂停账户，二级隔离数据，三级启动全网安全检查。熔断解除需运营方完成原因分析并由服务商重新通过安全认证。
usecase_33: 在“智慧物流数据协作区”中，所有数据使用活动必须通过“日志存证-可信执行环境验证-异常熔断”实现全流程可追溯。日志需覆盖数据调度、处理、传输及销毁环节，涉及敏感运输路径或国际数据流动时，需附加可信执行环境（TEE）证明，证明经哈希后锚定至区块链，原始日志保存期不得少于3年。个人位置信息处理应采用同态加密与联邦学习等隐私增强技术，统计数据共享需满足差分隐私（ε≤1.2）标准。数据服务方负责合规性验证，并向运营管理方提交第三方检测报告。若单日异常访问量超过日均访问量140%，自动分三级熔断：一级暂停账户，二级隔离数据，三级启动全域安全巡检。解除熔断需管理方完成根因分析且服务方重新通过安全认证。
usecase_34: 在“金融数据互联空间”中，所有数据操作需通过“日志存证-零知识证明-异常熔断”机制保障全生命周期可追溯。日志管理应覆盖数据查询、分析、传输及销毁全流程，涉及敏感金融字段访问或跨境传输时，需附加零知识证明（ZKP）存证，证明内容哈希后锚定至金融联盟区块链，原始日志保存期不得少于7年。个人金融信息处理应采用同态加密与联邦学习等隐私增强技术，统计数据共享需满足差分隐私（ε≤1.3）要求。数据服务提供方需负责技术合规性验证，并向联盟运营方提交第三方检测报告。若单日异常访问量超过日均访问量125%，自动分三级熔断：一级暂停账户，二级隔离数据，三级启动全域安全巡检。解除熔断需联盟方完成根因分析且服务方重新通过安全认证。
usecase_35: 在“智慧农业数据合作区”内，所有数据使用活动需通过“日志存证-多方计算验证-异常熔断”实现全生命周期可追溯。日志管理应覆盖数据采集、处理、传输及销毁各环节，涉及敏感农田地块数据访问或数据跨境流动时，需附加多方计算（MPC）证明，证明内容哈希后锚定至农业联盟区块链，原始日志保存期不得少于5年。个人农户信息处理应采用同态加密与联邦学习等隐私增强技术，统计数据共享需满足差分隐私（ε≤1.1）要求。数据服务方负责技术合规性验证，并向运营管理方提交第三方检测报告。若单日异常访问量超过日均访问量135%，自动分三级熔断：一级暂停账户，二级隔离数据，三级启动全域安全巡检。解除熔断需管理方完成根因分析且服务方重新通过安全认证。
usecase_36: In the 'Healthcare Research Data Space', only individuals who are at least 16 years old, or meet the minimum age of consent in their jurisdiction, are permitted to register and access 'Clinical Trial Data Services'. Users under 21 must obtain explicit consent from a parent or legal guardian before using the Services. Accurate and complete registration details are required, and account credentials must not be shared or transferred. If registering or accessing the Services on behalf of an organization, the user must have the authority to agree to the Data Space Terms for that entity.
usecase_37: Within the 'Smart Energy Consortium', participants must be at least 18 years old, or the legal minimum age in their region, to register and access 'Grid Usage Analytics'. Those under 21 require parental or guardian approval. Registration mandates truthful and comprehensive information, and sharing of account credentials is strictly prohibited; users are accountable for all actions under their account. When acting on behalf of a company, the registrant must possess authorization to accept the Consortium's terms for that company.
usecase_38: The 'Agri-Food Data Exchange' requires that users be no younger than 15 years old, or the minimum age of digital consent in their country, to create an account and access 'Crop Yield Forecasting Services'. Users below 18 must secure parental or guardian permission. Registration information must be accurate and complete, and accounts are personal—credentials may not be disclosed or used by others. Users registering or accessing on behalf of another party must have the legal authority to bind that party to the Exchange's terms.
usecase_39: Access to the 'Urban Mobility Insights Platform' is permitted only to individuals aged 14 or above, or those meeting the minimum age of consent in their locale, for the use of 'Traffic Pattern Analysis Tools'. Users under 18 must have parental or guardian consent. Registration requires providing full and correct information, and account credentials must remain confidential and not be shared. If the account is created or used for another person or organization, the user must be authorized to accept the Platform's terms on their behalf.
usecase_40: In the 'Financial Data Collaboration Space', registration and access to 'Market Trend Dashboards' is allowed only for users who are at least 17 years old, or who satisfy their country's minimum age for consent. Users under 20 must have parental or guardian approval. Registrants must submit accurate and complete information, and may not share their account credentials or permit others to use their account. When acting for another individual or entity, the user must have the authority to agree to the Collaboration Space's terms for them.
usecase_41: If you believe your proprietary manufacturing process data has been misused within the 'Gaia-X Trusted Zone', please submit a formal complaint to the designated compliance office or complete the online incident report. We may restrict or remove datasets that are found or alleged to breach these Data Space Terms, and will revoke access for entities with repeated violations as necessary. Formal complaints regarding data misuse must include: an authorized representative's digital or physical signature; a detailed description of the proprietary data in question; the precise location of the suspected misuse within the data space; your contact information (address, phone, email); a declaration of good-faith belief that the use is unauthorized; and a statement affirming the accuracy of your claim under penalty of perjury.
usecase_42: Should you suspect that your confidential supply chain analytics have been improperly accessed in the 'Catena-X Network', you are required to notify the Data Governance Board via the official reporting channel or by submitting the prescribed form. We may suspend or remove access to content suspected of violating these participation rules, and will terminate data space credentials for repeat offenders as warranted. Your report must contain: a signed statement from an authorized agent; a description of the analytics asset in question; the data space location of the alleged breach; your full contact details; a good-faith assertion of unauthorized use; and a sworn statement of the claim's accuracy.
usecase_43: If you believe your organization's clinical trial results have been unlawfully shared within the 'European Health Data Space', please provide notice to the Data Stewardship Office or complete the infringement notification form. We may block or erase datasets that are believed to contravene these governance policies or are subject to credible infringement claims, and will deactivate accounts of persistent violators when appropriate. Written notifications must include: a signature from a duly authorized representative; a description of the clinical data at issue; the specific repository location of the alleged infringement; your address, telephone, and email; a statement of good-faith belief regarding the unauthorized use; and a declaration, under penalty of perjury, of the notice's accuracy and your authority to act.
usecase_44: If you suspect that your proprietary energy consumption data has been copied without authorization in the 'Smart Grid Data Exchange', you must send a detailed notice to the Data Compliance Team or use the official online complaint form. We may remove or restrict access to data assets that are determined or alleged to violate these network policies, and will revoke access rights for users with repeated infractions as necessary. Your written complaint must include: a physical or electronic signature of an authorized representative; a description of the energy data in question; the exact location of the suspected infringement within the platform; your contact information; a statement of good-faith belief that the use is unauthorized; and a certification of the accuracy of your claim under penalty of perjury.
usecase_45: If you believe your company's agricultural sensor data has been improperly distributed in the 'AgriData Commons', please notify the Data Rights Office or submit the online infringement form. We may disable or remove content that is determined or alleged to breach these Commons Terms, and will suspend accounts of repeat violators as appropriate. Your written notice must include: a signature from an authorized agent; a description of the sensor data allegedly infringed; the location of the material within the Commons; your address, phone, and email; a statement of good-faith belief that the use is not authorized; and a declaration, under penalty of perjury, that your notice is accurate and you are authorized to act on behalf of the data owner.
usecase_46: To participate in the 'Gaia-X Health Data Space', you must register an organization profile. During registration, you are required to submit accurate, current, and complete organizational details and update them as necessary. You are responsible for safeguarding your access credentials and must not share them with unauthorized entities. If you detect any suspicious activity involving your profile, promptly report it via: https://www.gaia-x.eu/support. You acknowledge that you bear full responsibility for all actions performed under your profile. The consortium reserves the right to suspend your access if you breach these guidelines, if illicit or non-compliant activities are detected, or if regulatory requirements are violated. To request profile deletion, use the same support link. Deletion is irreversible and all related data will be permanently erased.
usecase_47: Within the 'Catena-X Supplier Collaboration Space', suppliers must establish a verified company account to access shared supply chain data. When setting up the account, suppliers must provide truthful and up-to-date company information and ensure ongoing accuracy. Account credentials must be kept confidential and not disclosed to any external parties. Any indication of unauthorized account activity must be reported immediately at: https://catena-x.net/support. Suppliers are solely accountable for all transactions and data exchanges under their account. The platform may revoke account access at any time for non-compliance, suspicious activity, or legal violations. Account deletion requests should be submitted through the same support channel; once processed, all account data and content are permanently deleted and cannot be restored.
usecase_48: In the 'Smart Energy Data Exchange', energy providers are obligated to create a user account to access grid analytics services. During account creation, providers must enter precise and current registration details and maintain their accuracy. Passwords and authentication tokens must remain confidential and not be shared with third parties. If unauthorized access is suspected, providers must notify the exchange immediately at: https://energydataexchange.org/report. Providers accept full responsibility for all actions taken via their account. The exchange reserves the right to terminate accounts for policy violations, detected misuse, or breaches of applicable energy regulations. To delete an account, providers must contact the same reporting link; deletion is final and all associated records will be irretrievably removed.
usecase_49: For participation in the 'Federated Research Data Space', research institutions are required to establish a project account. Accurate and up-to-date project information must be provided at registration and kept current throughout the project lifecycle. Institutions are responsible for securing their login credentials and must not reveal them to collaborators outside the institution. Any suspected compromise must be reported without delay at: https://federatedresearch.org/security. Institutions are liable for all project activities conducted under their account. The data space administrators may disable accounts for violations of terms, evidence of data misuse, or breaches of research ethics. Account deletion requests must be submitted via the same security link; once deleted, all project data and metadata will be permanently purged.
usecase_50: To join the 'Agricultural Insights Data Platform', agribusinesses must set up a digital access account. During onboarding, accurate and up-to-date business information is required and must be maintained. Passwords must be kept confidential and not shared with any external consultants. If there is suspicion of unauthorized account use, notify the platform immediately at: https://agriinsights.com/help. The business is solely responsible for all activities under its account. The platform reserves the right to deactivate accounts for non-adherence to platform rules, detection of fraudulent activity, or violation of agri-data regulations. Account deletion requests should be made through the same help link; deletion is permanent and all related business data will be erased.
usecase_51: Certified academic researchers are allowed to retrieve 'Urban Air Quality Index Layers' from the Gaia-X Trusted Zone for environmental impact studies, but access to the high-resolution datasets is limited to 48 hours. During analysis, they must acknowledge Gaia-X as the data provider in all published reports and are expressly forbidden from sharing the original datasets with external collaborators. For private environmental consultancies wishing to embed the data into commercial analytics platforms, access is provided upon payment of a per-city-block licensing fee.
usecase_52: Authorized public health agencies may access 'Aggregated Mobility Heatmaps' from the European Health Data Space for pandemic response planning, with access to the detailed datasets expiring after 96 hours. Agencies are required to cite the European Health Data Space as the source in all official documentation and are not permitted to distribute the raw heatmap files to any third parties. For pharmaceutical companies intending to use the data in proprietary modeling tools, access is contingent on payment of a per-region usage fee.
usecase_53: Recognized energy grid operators are permitted to download 'Renewable Generation Forecasts' from the Energy Data Exchange for grid balancing purposes, with access to the forecast data valid for 7 days. Operators must reference the Energy Data Exchange as the data origin in all operational reports and are strictly barred from forwarding the original forecast files to other organizations. For technology vendors seeking to integrate the forecasts into commercial energy management systems, access is available upon payment of a per-megawatt capacity charge.
usecase_54: Registered logistics providers are allowed to obtain 'Port Container Movement Logs' from the Maritime Data Space for supply chain optimization, but access to the logs is revoked after 24 hours. While utilizing the logs, providers are obligated to attribute the Maritime Data Space as the data source in their internal dashboards and are strictly prohibited from transferring the original log files to external entities. For freight software developers wishing to incorporate the logs into proprietary applications, access is granted upon payment of a per-container fee.
usecase_55: Accredited agricultural cooperatives may access 'Satellite Crop Yield Estimates' from the AgriData Trust Zone for seasonal planning, with access to the estimate files expiring after 5 days. Cooperatives must credit the AgriData Trust Zone as the source in all planning documents and are expressly forbidden from redistributing the original estimate files to third parties. For agri-tech firms aiming to embed the estimates into commercial farm management solutions, access is provided upon payment of a per-hectare data fee.
usecase_56: Within the 'Gaia-X Trusted Zone', access to 'Frankfurt Smart Retail Sensors' is differentiated by user preference for demographic pattern analysis. Users consenting to such analysis receive immediate, high-resolution sensor data. Those declining consent are provided with aggregated, anonymized sensor outputs. Irrespective of user choice, the platform is categorically forbidden from generating or retaining any individual behavioral profiles from the data.
usecase_57: In the 'European Health Data Space', access to 'Hospital Visitor Flow Logs' is determined by the visitor's consent to occupancy analytics. Visitors who agree to analytics may view detailed, near real-time logs. Those who opt out are given access only to de-identified, summary-level data. Under all circumstances, the system must not create or store any personal movement profiles, regardless of consent status.
usecase_58: Across the 'Catena-X Manufacturing Network', access to 'Factory Floor Video Streams' is allocated based on an engineer's approval for safety compliance monitoring. Engineers who permit monitoring gain access to live, full-resolution streams. Those who do not consent are limited to delayed, privacy-filtered footage. In every case, the network is expressly barred from constructing or saving any biometric identifiers from the streams, no matter the engineer's consent.
usecase_59: Within the 'Smart Agriculture Data Space', access to 'Drone Crop Imagery' is stratified by the farmer's decision on pest detection analysis. Farmers who opt in receive real-time, detailed imagery. Those opting out are provided with processed, anonymized images. Regardless of the farmer's selection, the system is absolutely prohibited from extracting or archiving any geolocation-based farmer profiles from the imagery.
usecase_60: In the 'Urban Energy Sharing Platform', access to 'Building Energy Consumption Data' is contingent on the property owner's consent for usage pattern analytics. Owners who consent are granted access to granular, real-time consumption data. Those who decline receive only generalized, anonymized statistics. Irrespective of consent, the platform is strictly forbidden from developing or storing any occupant-specific energy usage profiles.
usecase_61: The energy insights platform GridVision is required to pay a per-query fee to access PowerGridCo's substation telemetry dataset, PG-Substation-Data. Its derived analytics product, GridHealthScore, can only be accessed through the platform's authorized API, with batch exports or redistribution expressly forbidden. All subscription income from this product is automatically split after each transaction via a blockchain smart contract: PowerGridCo receives 40% as a data royalty, while GridVision retains 60%. The revenue distribution is immutably recorded on-chain for audit purposes.
usecase_62: The healthcare analytics firm MedInsight must remit a usage-based fee for each access to BioTrust's clinical trial dataset, BT-Clinical-Results. Its resulting data product, TrialOutcomeIndex, is permitted to be queried solely through the platform's validated API, with any bulk download or onward sharing strictly disallowed. All subscription proceeds from this product are automatically allocated post-transaction by a smart contract: BioTrust is entitled to 30% as a data royalty, and MedInsight keeps 70%. Each distribution event is transparently logged on the blockchain for compliance.
usecase_63: The smart city platform UrbanSense is obligated to pay a per-access charge to utilize MetroData's aggregated pedestrian flow dataset, MD-Pedestrian-Counts. Its derivative dashboard, WalkabilityScore, may only be accessed via the platform's certified API, with batch extraction or redistribution categorically prohibited. All subscription revenues from this dashboard are automatically apportioned after every transaction through a smart contract: MetroData receives 25% as a data royalty, and UrbanSense retains 75%. The allocation record is permanently stored on-chain for traceability.
usecase_64: The agricultural analytics provider AgriMetrics must pay a per-request fee to access FarmNet's satellite crop imagery, FN-Crop-Images. Its derived product, YieldForecast, is only accessible through the platform's approved API, with any bulk download or redistribution strictly forbidden. All subscription revenue from this product is automatically divided after each transaction by a smart contract: FarmNet receives 20% as a data royalty, and AgriMetrics keeps 80%. Each revenue split is recorded on-chain for verification.
usecase_65: The financial risk assessment platform FinGuard is required to pay a per-API-call fee to access CreditSafe's business credit dataset, CS-BizCredit-Data. Its derivative risk scoring tool, FinRiskIndex, may only be accessed through the platform's certified API, with batch downloads or redistribution explicitly prohibited. All subscription revenue from this tool is automatically distributed after each transaction by a smart contract: CreditSafe receives 50% as a data royalty, and FinGuard retains 50%. The distribution is logged on-chain for transparency.
usecase_66: For access to the HealthDataSpace's clinical imaging dataset EU-Med-Images, MedAI Solutions must first provide a cross-border patient data protection clearance from its national authority. Prior to any transfer, the dataset must be re-anonymized within HealthDataSpace's Secure Processing Module (SPM). The data is permitted solely for algorithm development inside an accredited Secure Research Facility (SRF), and raw data is strictly prohibited from leaving the SRF; only validated models free of patient-level data may be exported. Access rights are limited to researchers jointly vetted and enrolled by both organizations, with all user activity logs required to be streamed in real-time to HealthDataSpace's audit server.
usecase_67: In the Gaia-X Trusted Zone, GreenGrid Analytics may access the SmartGrid Consortium's EU-Energy-Usage dataset only after submitting a cross-border compliance attestation from its regulatory body. Before any export, the dataset must be subject to a secondary pseudonymization process within the Consortium's Confidential Computing Environment (CCE). Usage is restricted to energy demand forecasting within a certified Data Science Sandbox (DSS), and raw data export is strictly forbidden; only aggregate forecasting models without underlying data may be transferred. Access is exclusively for analysts jointly approved and registered by both parties, and all access logs must be relayed in real-time to the Consortium's monitoring gateway.
usecase_68: To obtain access to the AgriDataSpace's Crop Yield Records EU-Agri-Yield, AgroTech Labs is required to first submit a cross-border agricultural data compliance certificate from its domestic regulator. Prior to export, the records must be re-anonymized within AgriDataSpace's Secure Data Vault (SDV). The data may only be used for yield prediction model development inside a pre-approved Secure Analytics Environment (SAE), and it is strictly prohibited to export raw records; only trained models devoid of original data may be shared. Access is strictly limited to data scientists jointly screened and registered by both entities, with all user actions being continuously reported in real-time to AgriDataSpace's oversight node.
usecase_69: Within the Maritime Data Exchange, OceanInsight Ltd. can access the EU-Port-Logistics dataset only after presenting a cross-border maritime data compliance declaration from its national authority. Before any data export, the dataset must be further anonymized in the Exchange's Trusted Data Processing Center (TDPC). The dataset is permitted solely for logistics optimization within a certified Secure Maritime Research Environment (SMRE), and exporting raw data is strictly forbidden; only optimization models that exclude source data may be exported. Access is restricted to engineers jointly authorized and registered by both parties, with all session logs required to be transmitted in real-time to the Exchange's compliance monitor.
usecase_70: In the PharmaNet Data Space, BioCompute GmbH may access the Clinical Trial Results EU-PharmaTrials only after submitting a cross-border pharmaceutical data compliance certificate from its home country's authority. Before any export, the data must undergo additional anonymization within PharmaNet's Secure Computation Facility (SCF). The data is permitted exclusively for drug efficacy analysis within a certified Secure Research Workspace (SRW), and raw data must not leave the SRW under any circumstances; only analytical outputs that do not contain source data may be exported. Access is granted solely to analysts jointly reviewed and registered by both organizations, and all access activities must be streamed in real-time to PharmaNet's monitoring hub.
usecase_71: Within the 'Gaia-X Trusted Zone', any accredited data contributor who identifies an integrity anomaly in shared 'Energy Consumption Metrics' is required to notify the consortium within 15 minutes. Upon notification, the platform will mark the dataset as 'Pending Validation' and halt all API access. The originating utility must deliver a root-cause report within 6 hours and implement a verified correction within 24 hours, or risk suspension of their data provisioning privileges. Should the same utility encounter more than three such flagged events in any rolling 90-day window, they will be escalated to enhanced compliance monitoring. Once the issue is cleared, the system will automatically dispatch update notifications to all consumers who accessed the data in the preceding 48 hours.
usecase_72: In the 'Healthcare Research Data Space', any authorized research institution that detects a data consistency problem in 'Clinical Trial Results' must file an incident report within 15 minutes. The data platform will immediately set the dataset status to 'Under Investigation' and block all further data queries. The data steward is obligated to provide a root-cause analysis within 6 hours and resolve the issue, subject to automated validation, within 24 hours, failing which their data sharing rights will be revoked. If the same institution accumulates more than three such incidents over a 90-day span, they will be subjected to intensified oversight. Upon resolution, the system will notify all parties who retrieved the affected data in the last 48 hours.
usecase_73: Within the 'Smart Agriculture Data Exchange', any certified farm cooperative that uncovers a data accuracy discrepancy in 'Crop Yield Forecasts' is mandated to report it within 15 minutes. The exchange will then label the dataset as 'Review Pending' and suspend all downstream data feeds. The data originator must submit a root-cause explanation within 6 hours and complete a validated fix within 24 hours, or their ability to publish data will be put on hold. If more than three such occurrences are attributed to the same cooperative in a 90-day period, they will be placed under stricter scrutiny. After resolution, the platform will automatically inform all users who accessed the data in the prior 48 hours.
usecase_74: In the 'Supply Chain Transparency Network', any registered logistics partner who identifies a data reliability issue in 'Shipment Tracking Records' is obliged to report the issue within 15 minutes. The system will flag the records as 'Temporarily Suspended' and prevent any further data synchronization. The responsible partner must deliver a root-cause assessment within 6 hours and implement a correction, which must pass automated checks, within 24 hours, or face suspension of their data publishing capabilities. If the same partner experiences more than three such incidents in a 90-day timeframe, they will be added to a watchlist for heightened review. Once resolved, the system will automatically notify all stakeholders who accessed the data in the last 48 hours.
usecase_75: Within the 'Urban Infrastructure Data Space', any licensed construction firm that detects a data validity issue in 'Building Permit Records' is compelled to report it within 15 minutes. The data space will immediately mark the records as 'Under Audit' and disable all related data services. The data provider must submit a root-cause analysis within 6 hours and deliver a fix, subject to automated verification, within 24 hours, or their publishing rights will be suspended. Should the same firm have more than three such incidents within a 90-day interval, they will be placed under increased compliance review. After the issue is resolved, the system will automatically send correction alerts to all entities who accessed the records in the preceding 48 hours.
usecase_76: Prior to utilizing energy consumption datasets for predictive analytics, smart grid solution providers are required to submit a 'model transparency assessment' and verify that the pre-deployment fairness metric does not exceed 0.05. The resulting analytics model must undergo impartial bias and resilience testing within a certified Gaia-X Trusted Zone sandbox. Upon successful validation, a summary of findings, intended application, and a record of data sources must be disclosed on the sectoral data exchange portal. Post-deployment, the platform administrator reserves the authority to perform ongoing bias audits, and if detrimental effects on consumer welfare are detected, the model's operational approval may be rescinded.
usecase_77: Before leveraging aggregated patient cohort data for clinical decision support system development, healthcare technology vendors must file a 'systemic risk evaluation' and demonstrate that the model's fairness index remains below 0.05 prior to launch. The developed system must be validated for bias and robustness in an independent health data sandbox. Following successful assessment, the evaluation report, intended clinical use, and data provenance documentation must be published on the national health data registry. After deployment, the health authority maintains the right to conduct continuous bias surveillance, and should adverse impacts on patient safety be identified, the system's certification may be withdrawn.
usecase_78: Prior to employing supply chain traceability data for federated AI training, Tier-1 automotive suppliers are obligated to submit an 'algorithmic accountability dossier' and confirm that the model's pre-release fairness score is under 0.05. The trained federated model must be subjected to unbiased bias and robustness evaluation within a Catena-X Network sandbox. Once approved, the assessment summary, project objectives, and data usage inventory must be made available on the Catena-X transparency portal. After rollout, the network steward retains the prerogative to initiate ongoing bias monitoring, and if the model is found to compromise supply chain integrity, its access privileges may be revoked.
usecase_79: Before using satellite imagery data for environmental risk modeling, environmental research consortia must provide a 'model impact disclosure' and ensure the model's fairness index is below 0.05 prior to deployment. The constructed model must be tested for bias and robustness in a neutral Earth Observation Data Space sandbox. Upon passing these tests, the evaluation synopsis, modeling intent, and data utilization log must be published on the open environmental data platform. Post-deployment, the data space coordinator reserves the right to conduct persistent bias checks, and if the model is shown to negatively affect public environmental interests, its deployment authorization can be rescinded.
usecase_80: Prior to applying financial transaction datasets for anti-fraud AI development, fintech service providers must submit a 'bias and impact assessment' and guarantee that the model's fairness index does not surpass 0.05 before going live. The trained anti-fraud model must be validated for bias and resilience in an independent financial data sandbox. After successful validation, the evaluation summary, intended use case, and data usage record must be disclosed on the financial data space public portal. Following deployment, the data space operator holds the right to perform ongoing bias monitoring, and if the model is found to undermine financial system integrity, its deployment license may be revoked.
usecase_81: The 'Urban Air Quality Dataset AQ-2025', curated by the environmental consortium CleanAirNet, is distributed under a 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike' (CC BY-NC-SA) license. All participants may adapt and build upon the dataset, provided they clearly credit CleanAirNet using the dataset's persistent identifier in all publications and derivative metadata. Any resulting datasets must also be shared under a comparable CC BY-NC-SA license. Public sector agencies are permitted complimentary access, whereas private sector organizations are required to remit a data access fee.
usecase_82: Within the 'AgriData Space', the 'Crop Yield Records 2023' dataset, managed by the AgriInsight Alliance, is governed by a 'CC BY-SA' license. Stakeholders are authorized to transform and generate new datasets from the original, contingent on explicit attribution to AgriInsight Alliance via the dataset's DOI in all derivative outputs and metadata. All new datasets derived from this source must be published under the same CC BY-SA terms. Research institutions are exempt from usage charges, but agribusinesses must pay a licensing fee for access.
usecase_83: The 'Smart Energy Grid Consortium' provides the 'Grid Load Profiles 2022' dataset, maintained by PowerDataHub, under an 'Attribution-ShareAlike' (CC BY-SA) license. Any consortium member may alter and develop derivative datasets, as long as PowerDataHub is credited through the official dataset DOI in both usage documentation and derivative metadata. All derivative works must be distributed under an equivalent CC BY-SA license. Academic researchers are allowed to access the data at no cost, while energy companies are subject to a service fee.
usecase_84: In the 'Health Data Exchange', the 'Clinical Trial Outcomes 2021' dataset, released by MedDataTrust, is licensed under 'CC BY-SA'. All authorized users may revise and produce derivative datasets, provided that MedDataTrust is acknowledged using the dataset's DOI in all reports and derivative metadata. Any new datasets must be made available under the same CC BY-SA license. University-affiliated researchers receive free access, whereas pharmaceutical firms must pay a data usage fee.
usecase_85: The 'Maritime Analytics Network' offers the 'Global Shipping Routes 2020' dataset, published by SeaData Collective, under a 'CC BY-SA' license. All network participants may edit and create derivative datasets, on the condition that SeaData Collective is cited via the dataset's DOI in all usage summaries and derivative metadata. All derivatives must be released under an equivalent CC BY-SA license. Non-profit organizations are granted complimentary access, while logistics companies are required to pay an operational access fee.
usecase_86: The 'Federated Clinical Data Space' provides access to the 'OncoTrial-Images' dataset, curated by a network of cancer research centers, under a 'NonCommercial-Attribution-NoModification' (CC BY-NC-ND) license. The dataset is strictly for academic research purposes and may not be altered in any way. Academic institutions must secure ethics board approval prior to utilization and must credit the data origin in all scholarly outputs. Biotech firms requesting access are required to sign an addendum forbidding AI training applications and agree to a maintenance fee set at double the usual rate.
usecase_87: Within the 'Gaia-X Health Data Trust', the 'NeuroScan-Consortium Dataset', managed by a coalition of neuroscience clinics, is subject to 'Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivatives' (CC BY-NC-ND) licensing. Data usage is restricted to non-profit research only, with all modifications expressly forbidden. University researchers must obtain institutional review board clearance before accessing the data and must reference the dataset in all published findings. MedTech vendors seeking access must enter a supplementary contract banning the use of data for machine learning development and pay a maintenance charge at twice the regular fee.
usecase_88: The 'European Genomics Data Space' regulates the 'RareGene-Seq' dataset, aggregated by a pan-European hospital alliance, under a 'CC BY-NC-ND' license. The dataset is exclusively available for non-commercial scientific investigation, and any data transformation is not allowed. Investigators must receive ethics committee authorization prior to use and are obligated to cite the data source in all dissemination materials. Diagnostics companies applying for access must execute an additional agreement that prohibits AI model training and mandates a maintenance fee at double the standard amount.
usecase_89: In the 'Smart Medical Imaging Exchange', the 'CardioScan-Collective' dataset, provided by a group of cardiology clinics, is governed by a 'NonCommercial-Attribution-NoDerivatives' (CC BY-NC-ND) license. The data may only be used for academic research, with no alterations permitted. Researchers are required to obtain prior approval from a medical ethics board and must acknowledge the data source in all resulting articles. Health analytics firms requesting access must sign a supplementary agreement barring the use of the data for artificial intelligence training and pay a maintenance fee twice the standard rate.
usecase_90: The 'Asia-Pacific Health Data Network' oversees the 'PediatricRare-Images' dataset, contributed by a consortium of children's hospitals, under a 'CC BY-NC-ND' license. The data is licensed solely for non-commercial research, and modifications are strictly disallowed. Research teams must secure ethics committee approval before any use and must provide explicit attribution in all reports and publications. Pharmaceutical manufacturers seeking access must agree to a supplemental contract that prohibits AI training and requires payment of a maintenance fee at double the normal rate.
usecase_91: Within the Gaia-X Trusted Zone, the 'Aggregated Energy Consumption Dataset 2024' provided by the National Grid Authority is distributed under 'Attribution' (CC BY 4.0), granting broad rights for use and redistribution. Recipients are required to fulfill two ongoing obligations: submit a biannual report on data-driven efficiency improvements; and, if launching a subscription-based analytics platform leveraging this dataset, allocate 1% of annual subscription revenue to the national open data stewardship fund. Should a data delivery outage persist beyond two hours, all active platform operators must promptly submit disruption impact assessments.
usecase_92: The 'Open Marine Biodiversity Records 2023', curated by the Oceanic Research Consortium and shared in the Blue Data Space, are licensed under 'Attribution' (CC BY 4.0), enabling unrestricted use and sharing. All users are obliged to: file a semi-annual summary of research outcomes utilizing the data; and, if a paid environmental monitoring service is created from these records, contribute 1% of yearly profits to the marine data sustainability trust. In case of a system downtime exceeding two hours, every current service provider must submit a detailed incident impact report.
usecase_93: In the HealthDataNet collaborative environment, the 'Clinical Trial Outcomes Dataset 2022' released by the National Health Institute is made available under 'Attribution' (CC BY 4.0), allowing extensive use and redistribution. Users are bound by two recurring duties: deliver a quarterly impact report on healthcare improvements achieved; and, if a commercial diagnostic tool is developed using this dataset, remit 1% of its annual sales revenue to the public health data upkeep fund. If a service interruption lasts more than two hours, all active diagnostic tool vendors are required to submit incident impact documentation.
usecase_94: The 'Urban Air Quality Sensor Feeds 2025', published by the Smart City Authority in the Urban Data Exchange, are licensed under 'Attribution' (CC BY 4.0), authorizing wide-ranging use and redistribution. All participants must comply with two ongoing obligations: provide a quarterly evaluation of environmental impact derived from data usage; and, if a commercial mobile application is built using these feeds, donate 1% of its yearly gross revenue to the city’s environmental data fund. Should a data service outage exceed two hours, all active app developers are mandated to file incident impact logs.
usecase_95: Within the AgriDataSpace, the 'Crop Yield Satellite Imagery 2024' dataset, issued by the National Agriculture Board, is licensed under 'Attribution' (CC BY 4.0), supporting open use and redistribution. Users are required to: submit a quarterly report detailing agricultural productivity gains; and, if a fee-based farm advisory service is established using this imagery, contribute 1% of annual service revenue to the agricultural data maintenance pool. If a service disruption surpasses two hours, all currently active advisory service providers must submit incident impact records.
usecase_96: The 'Open Science Data Repository', curated by the National Research Council, utilizes a stewardship model governed by 'Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike' (CC BY-NC-SA). Researchers are permitted to adapt and remix datasets for non-commercial academic projects, provided all resulting works are distributed under the same CC BY-NC-SA terms. Upon publishing a derivative dataset, contributors must record its checksum on the official research data blockchain and clearly reference the original dataset's accession number in the metadata. Any commercial deployment of the data or derivatives in industry-sponsored research requires the purchase of an annual commercial license.
usecase_97: The 'Urban Planning Blueprint Archive', managed by the City Heritage Authority, operates under an 'Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike' (CC BY-NC-SA) framework. Urban designers may modify and combine blueprints for non-commercial city planning proposals, but all new works must be shared under identical CC BY-NC-SA conditions. When submitting a modified blueprint, users are required to register its digital fingerprint on the municipal planning blockchain and visibly cite the source blueprint's archival code in the project documentation. Separate annual commercial licensing is mandatory for any use of these materials or their adaptations in for-profit construction projects or trade fairs.
usecase_98: The 'Digital Folk Music Collection', maintained by the National Arts Consortium, is governed by an 'Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike' (CC BY-NC-SA) license. Musicians are allowed to create non-commercial remixes and arrangements, with the stipulation that all such works are released under the same CC BY-NC-SA license. When releasing a new arrangement, the musician must submit its hash to the cultural provenance blockchain and include the original recording's catalog number in the release notes. For any commercial performance or distribution of these works or their derivatives, an annual commercial license must be obtained.
usecase_99: The 'Sustainable Agriculture Knowledge Hub', published by the Global Agri-Innovation Network, enforces an 'Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike' (CC BY-NC-SA) policy. Agronomists may adapt and remix best practice guides for non-commercial educational purposes, ensuring all derivatives are licensed under CC BY-NC-SA. Upon publication of a derivative guide, the contributor must log its cryptographic hash on the agri-knowledge blockchain and display the original guide's reference ID in the document preface. Commercial use of these guides or their adaptations in paid training programs or agri-business expos requires an annual commercial license.
usecase_100: The 'Open Medical Imaging Dataset', provided by the International Radiology Alliance, is distributed under an 'Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike' (CC BY-NC-SA) license. Medical researchers are permitted to preprocess and combine images for non-commercial research, with the obligation that all resulting datasets are shared under the same CC BY-NC-SA license. When a new dataset is published, its hash must be recorded on the medical data blockchain, and the original dataset's unique identifier must be included in the dataset's metadata. Any commercial application of these images or their derivatives in diagnostic software or commercial studies necessitates the purchase of an annual commercial license.
